title: Systematization of Scientific Concepts and Strengthening Inquiry Processes Through Scaffolding-Based Concept Mapping Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts in scientific disciplines, logical reasoning skills, foundational comprehension of experimental design and data analysis, and experience with the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: In a digitally enabled collaborative learning environment, this course provides personalized scaffolding tailored to learners' prior knowledge levels and systematically emphasizes the scientific inquiry process (observation-hypothesis-experimentation-analysis-conclusion).

learning_goals: Learners collaboratively design concept maps reflecting hypothesis verification processes by connecting core concepts of given science topics to experimental/observational data.
Learners visualize causal relationships between concepts and independent/dependent variable structures based on scaffolding support levels using digital tools.
Learners improve the logical consistency and scientific evidence-based validity of concept maps by over 80% through peer assessment and derive conclusions based on analysis results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
